title: If 4371 digits were used in a book determine the number of pages of the book.? - Quora

response.answer_text: A assume you mean when you look at the page numbers, and count up the total number of times any digit appears, how many pages will it have if the total is 4371. First assume the first page is labeled page 1 and a page constitutes one side of the page. Single-digit pages is 9x1 digits =9 Double-digit is (99–9)x2=180 Triple is (999–99)x3=2700 Now it is obvious that the book has pages in the thousands. Page 999 has 2819 digits. Every page thereafter equals 4 digits. 4371–2819=1552 digits more than page 999 1552/4=388 pages more than page 999 999+388=1387 pages.

S. Amir Hossein Shobeyri,, Mathivanan Palraj, Steven Fussell and Voicu Dascau, are all basically correct as answering the question as asked. However, partly because of the number being 2 pages out, and partly because 4371 is a triangular number, I suspect that the question is wrongly worded. It should be something like: If the sum of the page numbers used in a a book it 4371, determine the number of pages in the book.Then the answer is 93, because 93 (93 +1)/2 = 4371.
